messages.message: So i found an interesting bug. Not sure which space to place it in. Under file explorer if you create a new folder called "unzip" , it will bring back a trackback error. I have a feeling wherever this api code is living we have import unzip in the python file and its thinking its trying to use the module. curious why this isnt getting passed in a physical string value back to the function
interesting!! for anyone looking to reproduce, it works to create it in the root of a drive but not in a nested folder

looks like it's this url rule:
```handler.add_url_rule(
    '/<string:repo_owner>/<string:repo_name>/fs/<string:mount_point>/<path:path>/unzip',
    view_func=UnzipAPIView.as_view(name='unzip_view'))```
And we'd have the same problem with folders called move, copy, or create_zip
@Jessica Yes, looks like this collides with the URL matching rule
Btw, we are finishing up API V2 for the file system, and this problem would go away since we no longer mix action and path in the same URL endpoint @Adrian right?
@joshbronko Thanks for letting us know about this!
I had it in a nested folder on my test
It's funny when you are trying to unzip a ibsolution so you create a folder called unzip for the heck of it. Haha
Correct, this should go away with v2.
